result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ray Daniel Watson

records.addlTxt: Letter from Defendants mother.
Order for Presentence Investigation Report signed and filed.

Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Ray Daniel Watson.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Trial proceeded. Jury questions addressed on the record. Jury in box at 9:39 am. Jury out of box for continued deliberations. 
At the hour of 10:46 am the jury indicated they had reached a verdict. 
Jury in the box at 11:00 am. returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts, which then were read into the record.

"We, the jury, find the defendant, **, GUILTY of COUNTS 1 AND 2, as charged in the Information."

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. Jury dismissed for the day.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. 

Court ordered a presentence investigation without a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 12/20/22 at 8:30 am, branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case recalled at 1:30 pm.
Jury in box. 
Sworn for the state: Detective Tony Castro. Exhibits addressed. Cross exam. Sidebar. 
State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 2:18 pm. Court discusses sidebars.
Defense rests.
Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify. 
Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  
Jury in the box at 3:00 pm.    
State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.
Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:03 pm. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Love and Diaz, who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Case recalled. Jury in box. Jury questions addressed on the record.   
At the hour of 4:57 jury dismissed for the day, but ordered to return at 9:00am tomorrow, branch 17.

Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Ray Daniel Watson.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Trial proceeded.
Jury back in box.  
Sworn for the state: MPD Forensic Investigator, Jason Reifschneider. No cross exam.
Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department, Latent Print Examiner, Matthew Maudlin. Direct. Cross exam.
Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department, Detective Scott Lackovic. Exhibits addressed.
Brief sidebar. Court takes short break. Jury out of box.
Jury in box. Cross exam. exhibits addressed. Redirect. Cross.
State requests brief recess . Jury out box. 
Jury in box. 
Sworn for the state: Detective Michael Martin, City of Milwaukee Police Department. Exhibits addressed. Cross exam. 
Sworn for the state: MPD Sargent Rodolfo Alvarado.  Exhibits addressed. Cross. Short sidebar. 
At the hour of 11:36 am court dismisses jurors for lunch and ordered to return at 1:15 pm. 
Court addresses sidebars before dismissing parties for lunch.
Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Ray Daniel Watson.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury trial. Jury trial proceeded. Jury panel in court at the hour of 10:07 am. Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:17 am. Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled. Jury list received and filed. Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Court instructed jury. Court breaks for lunch. Jury out of the box at the hour of 11:58 am; Juror #16 stayed in courtroom; Covid-19 exposure discussion placed on the record; juror #16 is designated as an alternate juror; both parties do not object. Jury back in the box at the hour of 1:42 pm. Jurors sworn. Opening statements by state and defense. Trial proceeded. Sworn for the state: #1 Sunny S. Direct examination. Exhibit 1, 35 marked. Cross examination proceeded. Court takes short break. Jury out of the box at the hour of 2:58 pm. Jury back in the box at the hour of 3:10 pm. Sworn for the state: #2 Quavion D. Direct examination. Cross examination proceeded. Sworn for the state: #3 Amjad A. Direct examination. Exhibits 28, 29, 30 marked. Cross examination proceeded. Sworn for the state: #4 Milwaukee Police Department Detective Froilan Santiago. Direct examination. Exhibits 1, 36 marked, offered and received. Cross examination proceeded. Exhibits 2, 101 marked, offered and received . Re-direct and re-cross. #5 Milwaukee Police Department Forensic Investigator Yvette Panfil. Direct examination. Cross examination proceeded. Exhibit 101, 102. Re-direct. Re-cross. Exhibit 103, 104. #6 Milwaukee Police Department Forensic Investigator Chet St. Clair. Direct examination. Cross examination proceeded. Court breaks jurors for the day and advises jurors to return by 9:00 am on September 20, 2022. Jury out of the box at the hour of 4:44 pm. Jury trial scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Exhibit List.  Received and Filed. nk

Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Ray Daniel Watson.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for jury trial.  Parties request jury trial to be scheduled to September 19, 2022.  Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding his right to a Miranda Goodchild hearing.  Court finds the defendant freely, knowingly, and voluntarily waives a Miranda Goodchild hearing.  Court allows jury trial to be rescheduled to the following week, September 19, 2022 at 9:00 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, 316 SB.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: Defense's Motion in Limine

Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Ray Daniel Watson.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a SPEEDY jury trial.  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  Court is in trial on another matter but anticipates to try this matter (along with 22CF1670) on September 14, 2022 at 9:00 AM.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.

Defendant Ray Daniel Watson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Ray Daniel Watson.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Off the record. State and defense prepared to proceed to trial. Jury Trial remains calendared for 09-12-2022 at 8:30 am, Branch 36..
State's Amended Witness List, filed

Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pretrial.  Defense received offer from state.  Defendant does not accept offer.  State's offer revoked.  Any motions to be filed by jury status hearing.  Case remains calendared for jury status hearing September 9, 2022 at 8:30 am, and jury trial September 12, 2022 at 8:30 am.
State's Witness List.  Received and Filed.  nk
Received and Filed: Scheduling Order for JT 9-12-22

Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a motion hearing.  Joinder motion argued and GRANTED by the court.  Court scheduled final pre-trial and jury status dates.  Speedy expires on October 31, 2022.  SPEEDY Jury Trial remains calendared on September 12, 2022 at 08:30 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: State's Motion for Joinder

Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense enters a demand for SPEEDY trial.  Speedy demand expires on October 31, 2022.  State intends to file a joinder motion.  Court schedules motion and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective T. Castro. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Stephen Sargent; filed.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, appear by video. Defendant Ray Daniel Watson not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Sargent to be appointed pending a conflit check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with AAA-J,; Metro by T-mobile,; QMD,;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ray Daniel Watson in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ray Daniel Watson appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense motioned to dismiss case due to lack of evidence. Court denied motion. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
